revised_title: Experimental Treatment of Trypanosomiasis in Animals: Atoxyl and Trypan Red
tldr: The author investigates various treatments for trypanosomiasis in animals, focusing on the effectiveness of atoxyl, trypan red, and an arsenic-aniline compound. The study finds that the arsenic-aniline compound has fewer toxic side effects and a longer-lasting effect, making it a promising treatment for human trypanosomiasis.
